pr_title: Add marker for classes that should not be stored

timeline.message: Add marker for classes that should not be stored

timeline.body:
Add `@Documented` as this is a documentation marker so should appear in the javadocs and is considered part of the public contract. I'd change the javadocs on this too to give developers a hint on what (not) to do, something like: ``` Objects of types that are annotated with this method must not be stored as they may be invalidated at any time.

In particular, you should not:

  • Store annotated objects on a field
  • Cache annotated objects in any collection

Doing so may result in memory leaks and/or result in you operating on a stale object, meaning your operations will fail, often silently.

Where objects have identifiers (usually a {@link UUID} or name), you should store the identifiers instead, and use these to get the required object from the API when needed.

```

timeline.bodyHTML:
Add @Documented as this is a documentation marker so should appear in the javadocs and is considered part of the public contract.

I'd change the javadocs on this too to give developers a hint on what (not) to do, something like:

Objects of types that are annotated with this method <strong>must not</strong> be stored as they may be invalidated at any time.

<p>In particular, you should not:</p>

<ul>
    <li>Store annotated objects on a field</li>
    <li>Cache annotated objects in any collection</li>
</ul>

<p>Doing so may result in memory leaks and/or result in you operating on a stale object, meaning your operations will fail, often silently.</p>

<p>Where objects have identifiers (usually a {@link UUID} or name), you should store the identifiers instead, and use these to get the required object from the API when needed.</p>
